moTa: The Mitsubishi Lancer is available as a sedan. The 2017 Lancer starts at $17,795 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $835. It gets EPA-estimated 26-30 MPG combined. The Mitsubishi Lancer competes against models like the Chevrolet Sonic, Hyundai Sonata, and Mazda Mazda3. The Lancer is a good fit for commuters Commuter vehicles have a minimum EPA-estimated mileage of 30 mpg combined. May require specific trim level and/or optional features. .

The Mitsubishi Mirage is available as a hatchback, coupe and sedan. The 2018 Mirage starts at $13,395 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $895. It gets EPA-estimated 36-39 MPG combined. The Mitsubishi Mirage competes against models like the Toyota Corolla iM, Kia Rio, and Hyundai Elantra GT. The Mirage is a good fit for eco-friendly shoppers Eco-Friendly vehicles have a minimum EPA-estimated mileage of 35 mpg combined and include hybrids, diesels and even a few fuel-sipping gas-only cars. May require specific trim level and/or optional features. and commuters Commuter vehicles have a minimum EPA-estimated mileage of 30 mpg combined. May require specific trim level and/or optional features. .

The Mitsubishi Mirage G4 is available as a sedan. The 2018 Mirage G4 starts at $14,395 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $895. It gets EPA-estimated 35-37 MPG combined. The Mitsubishi Mirage G4 competes against models like the Nissan Versa, Hyundai Accent, and Kia Forte. The Mirage G4 is a good fit for eco-friendly shoppers Eco-Friendly vehicles have a minimum EPA-estimated mileage of 35 mpg combined and include hybrids, diesels and even a few fuel-sipping gas-only cars. May require specific trim level and/or optional features. and commuters Commuter vehicles have a minimum EPA-estimated mileage of 30 mpg combined. The Mitsubishi i-MiEV is available as a hatchback. The 2017 i-MiEV starts at $22,995 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $850. It gets EPA-estimated 112 MPG combined. The Mitsubishi i-MiEV competes against models like the Ford Fiesta, Toyota Prius, and Subaru Impreza.

The Mitsubishi Eclipse Cross is available as a SUV. The 2018 Eclipse Cross starts at $23,295 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $995. It gets EPA-estimated 25-27 MPG combined. The Mitsubishi Eclipse Cross competes against models like the Mazda CX-3, Hyundai Santa Fe, and Jeep Grand Cherokee.

The Mitsubishi Outlander is available as a SUV. The 2018 Outlander starts at $23,945 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $995. It gets EPA-estimated 22-27 MPG combined. The Mitsubishi Outlander competes against models like the Hyundai Santa Fe Sport, Hyundai Kona, and Chevrolet Equinox. The Outlander is a good fit for towing Towing vehicles can tow a minimum of 2,000 pounds (see specifications for maximum). May require specific trim level and/or optional features. and large families Large Family vehicles seat six or more occupants in three rows. .

The Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV is available as a SUV. The 2018 Outlander PHEV starts at $34,595 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $995. The Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV competes against models like the BMW X2, Honda Pilot, and Volkswagen Atlas.

The Mitsubishi Outlander Sport is available as a SUV. The 2018 Outlander Sport starts at $20,395 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $995. It gets EPA-estimated 25-27 MPG combined. The Mitsubishi Outlander Sport competes against models like the Toyota RAV4, Kia Niro, and Buick Encore.
